website_summaries.verdict: An exceptional weed torch for weed removal and other uses around the house or yard.
pros: Generates high enough temperatures to take care of multiple weeds grouped together at the same time
Can be used for other purposes, such as dead-matter removal
cons: Larger flame requires some time to develop the necessary feel for controlling the heat

customer_reviews.title: works well for clearing raised garden beds
customer_reviews.text: I have raised garden beds that I need to clear out for replanting, so I cannot use a herbicide. The following photos show the sequence of actions: before doing anything after pulling large stuff by hand (didn't take long) torching with the red dragon the final results My garden beds are make with 2 x 12 planks; don't try this with anything smaller or plastic. I will find out in several months if this was successful after I plant some winter squash.
customer_reviews.author: B. KURTZ

customer_reviews.title: The torch hose connects to the inside threads of the tank regulator valve. It does not connect to the outside threads.
customer_reviews.text: When I initially opened the package I was immediately disappointed to see that the torch connection had a fine thread and would not connect to my grill tank. I even went as far as processing a return of this item. After a little investigation I saw that my grill tank did in fact have the correct connection (fine threads) located on the inside of the tank valve. Keep in mind the connection has a left hand thread. That being said, the torch lights up with one click of the spark lighter. It is quite powerful too. Only open the valve on the torch an 1/8 of a turn when igniting. I found that setting to work well on average weeds.
customer_reviews.author: B. Carman

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure what to expect when I made this purchase. With that said, I have been delighted with the ease of use and with the fact I do not need to use chemicals on my gravel driveway any longer. I had an old dolly and found carting around a 20 gallon propane tank no problem. I was also pleasantly surprised by how little propane this product used. That is not to say it does not burn much propane, only that it burns less than I thought it would after reading reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Caravaneer

customer_reviews.title: Best weeding tool I ever had
customer_reviews.text: I can only hope that this tool lasts a long time but, I love it! I have a gravel driveway that has been a nightmare to keep weeded. This flame thrower weed dragon did the entire driveway (200 feet long) in one day. Fun and easy to use with no pulling, bending, poisoning. No back pain either. I don't know why I never thought of this before but I'm grateful to have it now.
customer_reviews.author: D. Pangal

customer_reviews.title: Kills vegetation almost instantly!
customer_reviews.text: Great torch that can clear LOTS of area in seconds. It just takes a brief wave of the torch over the problem area and the weed will be laying limp on the ground in a couple of hours. If you spray the ground before hand, you can kill the roots and seeds by creating steam. It's a simple tool and a little pricey but it really works. Every homeowner should have one. This burns hot!
customer_reviews.author: M. Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Works amazingly well.
customer_reviews.text: Works amazingly well. Cleared all plant life in my overgrown gravel driveway. Way cheaper than going the chemical route and I don't have to worry about runoff affecting the plants I want to actually keep alive. Seems to not burn through fuel at any alarming rate. I have yet to need to change out the propane tank and I've gotten a fair amount of use from it so far. Clearing my 600ft long driveway was no easy task. I don't know why they felt the need to paint the torch end of it and put a warning on it. Both the paint and label burns off within seconds once you get the flame going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Spaulding

customer_reviews.title: Paid for new, received used.
customer_reviews.text: Paid for a new product, received a used return. In an open box, scratched paint, regulator valve chipped and dirty, dirt in threads where someone had previously screwed onto it.
customer_reviews.author: C.Hume

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to clear out some sand spurs (Welcome to living in Florida). I also bought the dolly, and the pressure handle, but doubt I'll use the handle. Honestly keeping that thing depressed isn't a requirement, as the knob on this kit is in a place where it was extremely easy to control the throughput of the propane, and I don't have to worry about maintaining pressure. Quick delivery, easy to direct the flame. I will agree with an earlier poster that for someone tall (I'm 6'4), a longer pipe would of been easier, but this is manageable.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L Kirk

customer_reviews.title: An initial problem but quickly resolved by customer service!  'Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: This does NOT produce much of a flame at all. It's like a Bic lighter not like the roaring heat torch I was expecting for this price. I went and bought 3 new, full, propane tanks to use with this. It's the same underwhelming flame with each attempt. Not useful at all for weeds but you could light cigars, paper or dry grass with this. Rating Update: After a call to customer service, they diagnosed a faulty regulator. They sent a replacement and the torch is working like it should.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Rutherford

customer_reviews.title: Good torch with a small flaw..
customer_reviews.text: Torch works great, as other have said, makes a serious hot flame, very good. The bad... The paint used on the nozzle isn't sufficient to handle the heat and boiled off on the first use... Come on... Seriously, the operating conditions are known when you make these things, use a flame rated paint for cryin' out loud... I have some, I'll sand it and refinish it.. Otherwise its susceptible to rust (which is already showing -- its been quite humid here). So, be prepared to get some flame rated paint for your new torch, which seems like should have been done at production... But otherwise, its a good torch, so I can't beat it up too much in the review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fire saftey
customer_reviews.text: this thing can be scary and intimidating!!! the flame is really hot and requires extreme caution. you could easily burn down your surroundings with it so I advise great caution and only used by an adult. it does the job well, however, I feel on should really consider circumstances, i.e., what your are burning and where, wind velocity, etc. Also, if you get too close you can burn your other plants without realizing it. I like it, I live in country but I would NOT put this in the hands of someone without knowledge of fire and its potential dangers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Chemicals Needed
customer_reviews.text: The Red Dragon VT2-23 works extremely well. I've seen others brands claim 500,000 BTUs but I can't imagine why you would need more the 100,000. This torch is extremely powerful. I was also pleased to see that the weeds can actually be killed. The instruction say to just apply the flame for a couple of seconds. This stops the photosynthesis in the plant. Don't actually burn the weed to ashes because it will grow again from the roots. Wait until it rains to use on mulched gardens. My family is much happier now that I don't apply chemicals!!!
customer_reviews.author: Roland Fritz

customer_reviews.title: I must be stupid
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this device just wasted an evening of my life... For the life of me, I cannot get it to work properly and it keeps going in to the "safety mode" where hardly any flame comes out. Yes, I've followed the instructions, barely cracked the valve on the propane tank, given it 10 secs to fill the hose and so on. Keep in mind, I'm a very handy and mechanical guy, but this thing is ridiculous. Perhaps I got a bad device, but back in the box this goes and back to using the 1 year ground clear for me.
customer_reviews.author: Da Bunkster

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this for burning my weeds. I am now using it to edge where I used to weed whack. Takes up less time than using the trimmer and lasts a lot longer in between having to do it. Now I have more down time to do what I want instead of doing chores all the time!
customer_reviews.author: C.H.

customer_reviews.title: doesn't seem like it does much at first
customer_reviews.text: Used 3 days ago on our back yard infested with goat head plants..doesn't seem like it does much at first..the weeds glowed a little then went back to looking the way the did before torching them. 3 days later and everything is dead that we wanted dead. We have dogs and chickens so we did not want to spray any chemicals on the ground. We also plan on planting the areas we torched, so no salt or vinegar mixtures would work either. Adds valuable biochar to soil. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jace

customer_reviews.title: Kills weeds with fire
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says. No more yanking weeds from between the pavers on my front walk or in my graveled areas. No more chemicals either. Just walk around with this magic wand and incinerate it all. You do have to be careful because it will set leaves, pine needles or anything else slightly combustible alight within about a 5-foot diameter. Most fun I've had killing weeds. The paint burns off the end of the torch the first 2 minutes of use, but I'm okay with that.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stoltz

customer_reviews.title: Cleans up walkways great
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts about this, but after 2 seasons use, I'm a believer. We have a few brick walkways and a brick patio. Weeds and grass grow profusely through the joints. A pass with flame cleans it all up without the use of questionable chemicals. You do have to do it a few times each season, but it's still better than using chemicals or trying to pull the offending weeds manually. It does use a lot of propane - be sure to have a spare cylinder ot two handy.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Frying weeds is just as much fun as it looks like
customer_reviews.text: Almost feels like a guilty pleasure using this thing, but if the biggest problem is not looking a bit odd using a blowtorch to kill weeds then it is doing the job well. Can buy the dolly if you need help lugging around your propane tank, but generally not needed. Takes a little practice to get good at it. No chemicals in the soil a big plus. Just keep a hose handy - haven't started a fire yet, but this thing generates a very powerful 6-12 inch tongue of flame. As long as you are reasonably careful it will make a lame job a lot more fun.
customer_reviews.author: ECoulter

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite toy. I have looked for years to find ...
customer_reviews.text: My new favorite toy. I have looked for years to find a solution to non stop weeds and moss growing in a large brick pavers patio area. Other things I have tried were so labor intensive and time consuming. I felt like I was always fighting an uphill battle. This tools works winderfully. It also works well for growth around the base of trees, Long grass and weeds along a fence line. AND, to melt the never ending pile of snow and ice in our yard in early spring.
customer_reviews.author: Chera L. Greene

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight Heavyweight- Weeds Beware!
customer_reviews.text: The Weed Dragon really proved itself. In little over an hour I managed to precisely destroy my yard's entire crop of weeds that had been mocking my futile attempts for years. It doesn't look like I'll have any trouble staying well ahead of the game. Fully assembled, easy to light and control, the 100k BTU flame was the perfect blend of power and precision. Thanks to the manufacturer for a wonderful product at a very good price.
customer_reviews.author: Keith in Silverdale

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work at all on crabgrass.
customer_reviews.text: I used this twice for long periods of time on crab grass and it made zero difference. This is not an effective way to kill weeds. I don't think you should believe all the positive reviews. It may be fun to own a flame thrower, but it didn't kill the weeds in my yard.
customer_reviews.author: D. C. Buttercup

customer_reviews.title: Works great and its fun
customer_reviews.text: Pay a little more and get the one with the handle trigger. I wish I had. Using this for burnt wood siding for a shed. Works great and its fun. The neighbors think I'm crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: what a find
customer_reviews.text: very happy with this purchase. Fast and easy to improve an overgrown yard without poisonous chemicals which would be dangerous to our dogs. We had thick vines and weeds along a fence, without this that job would be impossible. After a couple of days when the weeds die out the result is amazing. Follow basic safety precautions, with a hose of running water nearby of course, otherwise we recommend this without reservations.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Better for Large Patches of Weeds
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a monster and I have since learned that there is more of a pin-point torch that I wish I would have gotten for spot weeding. The flame on this is very powerful and I hold it in one hand while holding a hose in the other. It does start little fires very easily if you are weeding in or near any kind of mulch. I actually spray the area down with the hose first so I don't burn down my backyard. This would be great for large areas of weeds and with a little practice, I'll be better at spot-weeding with this too.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Arrived opened - and doesn't connect
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived in an open box - the gas valve was turned all the way on - and the regulator will not fit into a standard propane tank. What a waste of time. Thanks for sending me someone else's returned item - and for not indicating in the product description that it will not fit into a standard propane tank. Return...
customer_reviews.author: Freedom Lover

customer_reviews.title: Adjustment valve needs to be relocated
customer_reviews.text: The red Dragon works great and dependably. I have been using it to melt crack sealer for my asphalt driveway and it does the job admirably. My one beef is with the location of the flow valve. The valve is in an awkward location right at the top of the foam handle and when handling the wand, I found it difficult to position my hand where I wasn't accidentally turning the flow adjustment up or down, making it occasionally difficult to maintain my desired flame length.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Taber

customer_reviews.title: Environmentally friendly and fun!
customer_reviews.text: I live in an ecologically sensitive area that limits my ability to use herbicides to control weeds in my driveway or along the lakeshore. Luckily, the Red Dragon has me covered. Hook it up to a propane tank and giggle with glee as you unleash flaming death on the weeds without worrying about harmful pesticides leeching into the water. Plus, it’s a ton of fun.
customer_reviews.author: P. Wagstrom

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: If you turn up the flame this works very well and quickly. It could be a little longer, but not a deal breaker. It does use a lot of propane, compared to a grill. Time will tell if the weeds stay gone. Four stars.
customer_reviews.author: PaulTD

customer_reviews.title: Crack for weed haters
customer_reviews.text: My neighbors likely think I'm insane when I walk around wielding this flame thrower in the early summer evenings. I may or may not have almost burned our house down (not really, well sorta). This is truly an enjoyable way to get back at the weeds that come into my life. It engages the fire loving side of my personality which I really don't ever indulge (I swear I'm not a pyro!) Seriously though I do enjoy eradicating weeds with the Weed Dragon. It is my most recommended purchase of 2016.
customer_reviews.author: Genenavi

customer_reviews.title: Finally weeding is fun!
customer_reviews.text: I HATE weeding. It’s the worse yard work chore. And I hate spraying cancer causing chemicals that also end up in local water supplies. In the PNW weeds are awful starting in spring. If not using a weed killer I easily had 1-2 hours of back hurting weeding. I just killed them all with fire in 30-40 mins. I’m not sure if my neighbors were intrigued or terrified of my fire breathing dragon, because the torch roars. I can’t wait to weed again!
customer_reviews.author: Andy PDX

customer_reviews.title: Burning weeds all day
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought one of these years ago. I spent way too much time in the past weed-eating when I could've been using this instead. I've been using this to burn weeds out of my drainage ditches, fence lines, brick patio, and along any edges my mower can't quite get to. Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Nacho

customer_reviews.title: Love my dragon
customer_reviews.text: Just be aware that they ship US mail, so expect that it won't arrive by the promised date. It took mine 3 weeks to arrive. The product arrived in excellent condition and it works great. We love it. Scary powerful fun killing weeds. If you don't smoke, just one word of caution, close your doors and windows or your house will stink like cigarette smoke.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more Roundup
customer_reviews.text: I will never use Roundup again! You don't need to completely incinerate the weeds. A few seconds is all you need. I particularly found this useful for removing weeds from rock/stone paths and around block edging. Your neighbors might think it is strange as it sounds like a jet engine, but mine were convinced once I did a portion of their yard!
customer_reviews.author: ROK

customer_reviews.title: pressure regulator not correct
customer_reviews.text: I deducted one star because the pressure regulator wasn't working properly when my weed burner was delivered. The weed burner would barely maintain a very weak flame with the valves fully open and a full bottle of propane. I did a little troubleshooting and discovered the pressure regulator adjustment was incorrect. After a quick adjustment the weed burner now works as it should. I would highly discourage anyone removing the pressure regulator, like one reviewer said he did.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful in Dry Climates
customer_reviews.text: This works well, but is dangerous in our climate. We live in Colorado, which is dry to begin with usually. After it rains, and when the wind is at a minimal, is when we can use this. We purchased this especially for our long-needled pine trees. It can get out of control very quickly with these. The first time we used it a dormant bush burned up by getting too close targeting the pine needles. Pine needles are our problem. It works much better with live weeds!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy F.

customer_reviews.title: Cannot use smaller tanks. Too cumbersone and heavy for residential use .
customer_reviews.text: This description is misleading. You need to lug around a large BBQ sized propane tank. I bought it hoping to use a smaller , easier to manage size tank. The fittings on it do not allow you to use a smaller tank. Who wants to drag a 20lb propane around your property? The flame is too large and can it be adjusted either. If you’re buying this for Household use it is not a good option...look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: JIM b

customer_reviews.title: Fries the weeds and anything else that gets close
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, but beware this thing needs careful handling to avoid setting fire to yourself or your surroundings. On lowest setting it fried all the weeds on my driveway with ease. Years ago I used a kerosene version - this is way better and easier to control. I recommend the dolly to cart the propane cylinder because it would be very difficult to carry/control both.
customer_reviews.author: Simon D. Collier

customer_reviews.title: Weeds grow back within a week
customer_reviews.text: I had a smaller version weed burner and it never really worked well. Base on reviews and the product description I was hopeful this would do the trick and save us from needing chemicals. I tried it 2 ways: As a man I tried it first without reading the directions and burned everything to the ground, then as an intelligent man I read the instructions and burned more exactly like the directions instructed: make them wilt but do not incinerate.... In both cases the weeds were growing up from their burned or wilted remnants within a week. I would try to return it but already tossed the box. I really urge you to stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: BUSTER Gets Hot In A Hurry
customer_reviews.text: I Used To Get My Smoker's Fire Going With A Plumbers Propane Torch. What An Idiot I Was! I Watch The BBQ Pittmasters On TV And Noticed I Had It All Wrong. I Researched You-Tube And Watched One Of These Babies In Action And Learned It Is The Only Way To Go. This Unit Is So Simple A Child Can Use It (But Don't Let Them).....BUSTER
customer_reviews.author: BUSTER

customer_reviews.title: ARCH NEMESIS OF WEEDS
customer_reviews.text: If you hate weeds with a passion, then this is for you. This torch is the most satisfying way to get rid of weeds. Hook it up to propane tank, ignite, and boom! Weeds are dying a quick death. It's fantastic for rock areas and driveways. It's obviously not the most eco-conscious way to get rid of weeds, but I've convinced myself that it's better than the chemicals. Plus the satisfaction of seeing the weeds shrivel to nothing is worth the minimal carbon footprint. Several reviews state this is a fire hazard. Obviously it is. It's a blow torch. Keep a hose or extinguisher handy just in case. If you're in northern california, probably don't want to use this.
customer_reviews.author: J B

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love it. My wife hates it. Burning weeds is a heck of a lot faster than trying to pull the buggers out. My wife follows me with a garden hose to ensure the small fires I start are extinguished. Cant blame her :D
customer_reviews.author: Naval Academy Vet in NC

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: The connection to the propane arrived broken. Took off the plastic cap and the spring, ball bearing and plastic ring fell out. Called the vendor and they're sending me a new part. Apparently this has been an issue when buying this torch through Amazon. Somehow this piece arrives broken frequently.
customer_reviews.author: C. Willis

customer_reviews.title: lousy regulator - up date
customer_reviews.text: Followed instructions 6 + times on how to start burner. Gas will not flow through regulator. Tried on 3 different lp tanks. Going to send back entire unit for replacement or refund. Package says American made product. Must be an imported regulator of one not matched to unit properly. Follow up review. October 2019. Purchased new regulator for propane wand. A little teflon tape and a wrench and the wand works great. Lights up on the first attempt and burns all the weeds easily. Junked old regulator. Keeping propane wand.
customer_reviews.author: frederick williams

customer_reviews.title: Meh - a trigger would improve accuracy
customer_reviews.text: I burn weeds around our pond bank. This does ok but when you add the propane tank - it requires a wagon or rolling dolly to move. It’s cumbersome and it’s safety is a concern for that reason. Also - don’t plan to use it in your garden .. there is no trigger so the flame is constant. I accidentally burned several seedlings :( I like it for keeping our pond bank clear of noxious weeds and I plan to use it for our 1/4 acre wildflower meadow occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Great Torch Kit!
customer_reviews.text: We use this for a Raku Kiln and it works great! The 100000 BTU rating seems correct as this will really heat up the kiln. Does go through a lot of propane as expected but functions as it should. Simple to use and seems to be well made. Happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great garden tool, wouldn't  be a home owner without it!!!
customer_reviews.text: We love our new toy. This was easy to install and fire up! It only took us about 20 minutes to read all the instructions and get started. We have a acre lot that we wanted to get cleaned up with weeds. This beauty did the trick. You do not need to catch the weed on fire, just hold it close. Also recommended to have a fire extinguisher near when operating this gun. Lastly, complete after a rainy day to lessen the risk of a fire.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Yanez

customer_reviews.title: Like it for ivy; good for very particular uses
customer_reviews.text: Really good when surrounding area is non flammable. Ideal cases are weeds on concrete and weeds/vines grown into chain link fence. On normal garden weeds suffers from 'collateral damage' from difficulty of pinpointing heat and tends to set things on fire. It takes a lot of skill a close attention to use in these situations. I recommend having a bucket of water nearby or doing this in light rain. Mostly I use this on ivy either during light rain or just after heavy rain. Does a great job of knocking it back.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M. Olney

customer_reviews.title: I think this is a good one.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it comes with a regulator and I thought it might have more reliable operation. I can't compare it with the larger ones but it seems to work well. It is tough to use around other plants as it's easy to scorch everything in the vicinity. I will continue to use it. Too bad I can't use it on my lawn.
customer_reviews.author: SomewhatHandy

customer_reviews.title: Superb product.
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. I try to keep my vegetable garden chemical free. I harvested my garlic bed and had a great year. The bed - which I am about to replant for a fall harvesting is loaded with a very invasive ground cover and this flame thrower did the trick. Be sensible when using this to avoid mulch etc from catching fire. I expect great things from this product and also attached it to a hand truck.
customer_reviews.author: df Don

customer_reviews.title: It didn't work
customer_reviews.text: The product came in, in a timely manner but when it came down to using it, it didn't work. The regulator is bad and was shipped that way. I would not recommend this
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Cook

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: The Red Dragon works fantastic! Quick and easy to use. This puppy puts out a very powerful flame and heat. One or two quick passes over the weeds and they wilt immediately. The pic is a patch that I hit yesterday and you can see the weeds are all dying.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Made in America
customer_reviews.text: If you need to start a brush pile fire it is the best. Also works on brick patio and walk way. Better than buying grass and weed killer. Don't have to incinerate the grass or weeds, just enough to wilt them is enough. Set mine on a cart and strapped it tight, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia homestead

customer_reviews.title: Great for killing brush
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time. In my driveway, around the mail box, around the bottom of fences, to kill trees and brush. Works great. Can't wait till I can get rid of ice with this!! The tank is heavy to carry around and would recommend the Red Dragon CD-100 Propane Cylinder Dolly or similar.
customer_reviews.author: L. McCool

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Safety feature in propane connection falls out constantly. Not safe to use. Old style connection to 20lb tank. Seller's voicemail always full. No way of contacting and speaking with a real person. Waiting for Amazon to give my money back
customer_reviews.author: lttruck29

customer_reviews.title: The fun wears off quickly
customer_reviews.text: The fun wears off quickly, however nothing says "'Murica" like blasting your weeds instead of pulling them. I have an old paver driveway with grass and such growing up through the cracks. I can use only so much of that weed killer stuff before I feel the cancer growing in my bones. This works well.........it gets hot (I know, genius) I do wish it was a bit longer..........found myself hunched over for the duration and ended with some back pain because if it. However, it works as described and I will continue to use it when needed.
customer_reviews.author: What did I order?

customer_reviews.title: Works great and built well
customer_reviews.text: I have torched about everything in my yard. Ive burnt out some old tanks i needed to weld up, torched down some brush, got rid of some ants etc. I have put this thing to good use and works very well and has lasted through everything i have done with it, which has been a lot.
customer_reviews.author: chris5957

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great-One of my Favorite Tools
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite garden tools. It’s cheaper & more environmentally friendly than weed killer. But You cannot take too many safety precautions- it’s a blow torch. It gets super hot & will burn anything. So watch the dead leaves & mulch. This model works fine for me-once I turn it on, I burn off what I need without ever touching the controls until I turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Rudick

customer_reviews.title: Whoa, I keep praying for more weeds....
customer_reviews.text: ....but, I think they're too afraid to show their faces around here anymore. My neighbors think I'm psycho, but that's not new. Kills weeds great, and keeps them dead. Lots more fun and better for the environment than chemical weed killers too! It works great, worth the money in my estimation.
customer_reviews.author: Jon White

customer_reviews.title: Burning Weeds in the Garden!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing makes you feel more like a man than destroying unsightly weeds in your fall or spring garden than the pure firepower of the Red Dragon! While still considering all applicable safety precautions, I imagined myself as a Terran Firebat entrenched in the Zerg dominion. Fire it UP! I can tell you that nuking weeds is a lot more fun than breaking out the tiller, and the ashes of the burnt plant matter seep into the soil and provide essential nutrients without disturbing the natural fauna (worms) under the surface. You won't get all the seeds, so I recommend a second application of flames in the spring, just before you plant. The product is very simple to assemble and operate.
customer_reviews.author: RB Frost

customer_reviews.title: Several things are great about this unit
customer_reviews.text: Several things are great about this unit. 1) Sounds like a jet. 2) Replaces chemicals. 3) Allows you to see exactly where you have reached unlike a sprayer where you don't know until stuff starts to die. 4) FIRE Not so positive: Not for the kids. Without a squeeze valve, has potential for harm. Goes through gas quickly.
customer_reviews.author: sfs

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: After receiving the torch I read the instructions and became skeptical. Don't destroy the weed, just wilt it lightly? I hooked it up to a propane tank, fired it up according to the instructions (very important) and began to just wilt the weeds. Two days later the entire weed was dead! Just like the instructions said. It works as claimed and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles H. Stanton

customer_reviews.title: excellent - you will be pleased

customer_reviews.title: A good miniature of the torch I used for clearing irrigation ...

My standard procedure has always been "scorch & torch"- kill plants the first pass, come back later & burn them off. That saves fuel, and is more effective. If you haven't burned weeds before, there's a learning curve, but the control method is more than worth the trouble.

Only real gripe, apart from the fact that it is a flippin blowtorch and you have to be careful with it, is that it only kills the tops, so weeds will grow back. I suppose if you did it enough times, they would stay dead. To be fair, this is true of just about any method of weed killing, except digging out the whole root system, and a few of the nasty chemicals that are systemic killers.
